  • Method Details

    • setStage

      public void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Set the Stage that runs this object, also checks if the login prompt resulted in a failure, and said to close the app
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage object that contains the Main window

    • initialize

      public void initialize() throws IOException
      The function called at class creation, before the main window is shown. Used to handle setting up the AppState, getting the regions, and displaying the login screen
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws an IOException if the LoginPrompt.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • checkUpcoming

      public void checkUpcoming()
      Check if there is an appointment within the next 15 minutes, and display an alert if there is

    • initializeCalendar

      public void initializeCalendar()
      Create the calendar table found on the calendar tab LAMBDA USAGE: Line 173 - a lambda is used here to call the event handler easily and inline. This reduces the amount of boilerplate needed, making it easier to understand.

    • onCalendarRightNav

      public void onCalendarRightNav()
      Handle the press of the rightward calendar navigation, moving the start and end times based on the toggle's value

    • onCalendarLeftNav

      public void onCalendarLeftNav()
      Handle the press of the leftward calendar navigation, moving the start and end times based on the toggle's value

    • onRemoveAppointmentPress

      public void onRemoveAppointmentPress()
      Handle the press of the Delete appointment button. Confirms the user wishes to delete that appointment, and displays any errors

    • onEditAppointmentPress

      public void onEditAppointmentPress() throws IOException
      Handles the press of the Edit appointment button. It finds the selected appointment in the calendar table, creates a new AddAppointment window, and calls setAppointment to change it to the editing state. Finally, it checks if the new window returned a valid result, and updates the list
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the AddAppointment.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • onCreateAppointmentPress

      public void onCreateAppointmentPress() throws IOException
      Handles the press of the Create appointment button. It finds the selected appointment in the calendar table, creates a new AddAppointment window. Finally, it checks if the new window returned a valid result and updates the list
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the AddAppointment.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • initializeCustomersView

      public void initializeCustomersView()
      Set up the Customer table and set all the listeners

    • onCustomerEditPress

      public void onCustomerEditPress() throws IOException
      Handle the customer Edit button. Opens a new AddCustomer window, and calls setCustomer to change it to an editing window. Finally, it checks that the result is valid, and updates the lists
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the AddCustomer.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • onCustomerCreatePress

      public void onCustomerCreatePress() throws IOException
      Handle the customer Create button. Opens a new AddCustomer window, Finally, it checks that the result is valid, and updates the lists
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the AddCustomer.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • onCustomerDeletePress

      public void onCustomerDeletePress()
      Handle the customer Delete button press. Gets the selected customer from the table, and confirms with the user that they want to delete it. It then makes a database call to ensure there are no associated appointments that will stop the delete call

    • onRptAppoinmentTypePerMnth

      public void onRptAppoinmentTypePerMnth() throws IOException
      Handler for the open Appointment Type Per Month button
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the Rpt_AppointmentTypesPerMonth.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • onRptContactSchedule

      public void onRptContactSchedule() throws IOException
      Handler for the open Contact Schedule report button
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the Rpt_ContactSchedule.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • onRptCustomerByDivision

      public void onRptCustomerByDivision() throws IOException
      Handler for the open Rpt_CustomerByDivision report button
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the Rpt_CustomerByDivision.fxml file is not in the correct location

    • handleLogin

      public void handleLogin() throws IOException
      Opens the login window, and either closes the application, or updates the state with the user information
      Throws:
      IOException - throws an IOException if the LoginPrompt.fxml file is not in the correct location
